org.roug.osnine

Class PIA6821

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.roug.osnine.MemorySegment
      • org.roug.osnine.PIA6821

  • public abstract class PIA6821
extends MemorySegment
    Peripheral interface adapter. There are so many ways this adapter can be wired to devices that it should probably be an abstract class.

      • setInputLine

        public void setInputLine(int side,
                         int line,
                         boolean state)
        Set a new state on a line. The line must be configured as input in the DDR, or it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        side - A or B side of the PIA.
        line - Line number from 0 to 7.
        state - new state

      • signalC1

        public void signalC1(int side)
        Set interrupt input and cancel signal immediately.
        Parameters:
        side - - A or B side

      • signalC1

        public void signalC1(int side,
                     boolean state)
        Set interrupt input CA1 or CB1 to state. If bit 0 in CR is 0, then IRQs are disabled, but the status is kept.
        Parameters:
        side - - A or B side
        state - - true for high, false for low.

      • isC1On

        public boolean isC1On(int side)
        Check if CA1 or CB1 is on.
        Parameters:
        side - - A or B side of the PIA.
        Returns:
        true if register is on

      • signalC2

        public void signalC2(int side)
        Set interrupt input and cancel signal immediately.
        Parameters:
        side - - A or B side

      • signalC2

        public void signalC2(int side,
                     boolean state)
        Set interrupt input CA2 or CB2 to state. If bit 3 in CR is 0, then IRQs are disabled, but the status is kept. If bit 5 in CR is 1 then the interrupt line is an output and inputs are ignored.
        Parameters:
        side - - A or B side
        state - - true for high, false for low.

      • isC2On

        public boolean isC2On(int side)
        Check if CA2 or CB2 is on.
        Parameters:
        side - - A or B side of the PIA.
        Returns:
        true if register is on

      • setOutputCallback

        protected void setOutputCallback(int side,
                                 PIAOutputPins callback)
        Set up a method to be called when something is written to an output register.
        Parameters:
        side - - A or B side of the PIA.
        callback - - method to call.

      • setControlCallback

        protected void setControlCallback(int side,
                                  Signal callback)
        Set up a method to be called when a control pin is signalled.
        Parameters:
        side - - A or B side of the PIA.
        callback - - method to call.
